meanings.definition: A class that is a subset of a larger class.
meanings.sent1: In the library, the mystery novels and science fiction books are both subclasses of the fiction section.
meanings.sent2: The biology course has several subclasses, including botany, zoology, and microbiology.
meanings.sent3: The party guests were divided into subclasses based on their favorite type of music.
meanings.sent4: The different genres of movies can be seen as subclasses within the larger category of entertainment.
meanings.sent5: The various breeds of dogs are subclasses of the overall category of pets.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will subclasses the students into smaller groups for the group project.
meanings.sent2: It is important to subclasses the tasks to ensure efficient completion of the project.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally subclasses my wardrobe when trying to organize my clothes by color.
meanings.sent4: The chef will subclasses the ingredients before starting to cook the meal.
meanings.sent5: The manager decided to subclasses the workload among the team members to balance the responsibilities.
